ASPR.description: Aspect ratio of the current graphic device

ATYP.description: System aperture code (EPD:0, F/#:1, NA:2, STO:3)

CALD.description: Return value in specified CALLMACRO buffer

EXPE.description: Exponents: e to the power of x

EXPT.description: Exponents: 10 to the power of x

FLDX.description: X angle or height of specified field

FLDY.description: Y angle or height of specified field

GLCA.description: X direction vector of global coordinate

GLCB.description: Y direction vector of global coordinate

GLCC.description: Z direction vector of global coordinate

GRIN.description: Refractive index at the specified point of gradient index material

NOBJ.description: Number of object defined in the specified non-sequential surface

NPOS.description: Column position in non-sequential component editor

NPRO.description: Number or string of object property in non-sequential component editor

NSDC.description: Detecter Coherent data at specified pixel

NSDD.description: Detecter incoherent data at specified pixel

OPER.description: Operand data on merit function editor

PIXX.description: Number of pixels along x direction

PIXY.description: Number of pixels along y direction

PMOD.description: 0 if paraxial mode is off, else 1.

RAGX.description: The global x coordinate of the ray intercept.

RAGY.description: The global y coordinate of the ray intercept.

RAGZ.description: The global z coordinate of the ray intercept.

RANX.description: X direction cosine of surface normal

RANY.description: Y direction cosine of surface normal

RANZ.description: Z direction cosine of surface normal

RAYL.description: X direction cosine of the ray

RAYM.description: Y direction cosine of the ray

RAYN.description: Z direction cosine of the ray

RAYO.description: Ray optical path from the previous surface to the specified surface

RAYT.description: Ray trace path from the previous surface to the specified surface

SIGN.description: Returns -1 if the argument is less than zero, 0 if the argument is zero, and +1 if the argument is positive.

SOLM.description: The return value is data about the solve type and data for the specified multi configuration operand and configuration.

SOSO.description: Surface or object number of the current macro solve

WINL.description: Returns the number of the analysis window most recently opened by the keyword

WINN.description: Returns the number of open analysis windows.

XMIN.description: Minimum X coordinate of the graphic window

XMAX.description: Maximum X coordinate of the graphic window

YMIN.description: Minimum Y coordinate of the graphic window

YMAX.description: Maximum Y coordinate of the graphic window

$CALLSTR.description: Get string at specified index of the buffer

$GETSTRING.description: Get substring of string separated with space

$GETSTRINGC.description: Get substring of string separated with comma

$NOTE.description: Note defined on General System Data dialog

$TOLOPERAND.description: Operand name of the tolerance operand

CALLSETDBL.description: Set double precision floating point number to the buffer

CLOSEWINDOW.description: Close the window, or Set quiet mode

COLOR.description: Set color to the current pen

DELETEMFO.description: Delete operand on merit function editor

DELETETOL.description: Delete operand on tolerance analysis editor

EXPORTBMP.description: Export a graphic window to BMP file

EXPORTCAD.description: Export lens data to CAD file

EXPORTJPG.description: Export a graphic window to JPG file

EXPORTWMF.description: Export a graphic window to WMF file

GDATE.description: Insert the date under the lens name

GETEXTRADATA.description: Get extra data from the additional editor

GETGLASSDATA.description: Get glass data in the current catalog

GETTEXTFILE.description: Generate text file from the window

GLENSNAME.description: Insert the current lens name on the left top of the textbox

GLOBALTOLOCAL.description: Converts coordinate breaks from global to local references.

GTEXT.description: Put user defined text to the graphics

IMASHOW.description: Display IMA/BIM file on the viewer window

INPUT.description: INPUT provides a means for prompting the user for numeric or text data when the macro is run.

INSERTMFO.description: Insert operand to merit function editor

INSERTTOL.description: Insert operand to tolerance analysis editor

LINE.description: The primitive line drawing function for graphical displays.

LOADARCHIVE.description: Opens an existing Zemax archive (*.ZAR) file.

LOADCATALOG.description: Reloads glass and coating catalogs for the currently loaded lens.

LOADDETECTOR.description: Loads the data saved in a file to an NSC Detector Rectangle, Detector Color, Detector Polar, or Detector Volume object.

LOADLENS.description: Loads a new lens file, replacing any lens file currently in memory.

LOADMERIT.description: Loads a merit function file, replacing the merit function in the current lens.

LOADTOLERANCE.description: Loads a tolerance file, replacing the tolerances in the current lens.

LOCALTOGLOBAL.description: Converts coordinate breaks from local to global references.

LOCKWINDOW.description: Locks any one or all open windows.

MAKEFACETLIST.description: Makes an ASCI listing of the vertices of a faceted description of any importable CAD file.

MODIFYSETTINGS.description: Modifies data within the settings files used by GETTEXTFILE.

OPEN.description: Opens an existing text file for reading by the READ command.

OPTIMIZE.description: Invokes the optimization algorithm to optimize the current lens with the current merit function.

OPTRETURN.description: Return value to optimization using ZPLM

OUTPUT.description: Specifies destination for text output. Output is either to the screen, or to a file.

PARAXIAL.description: Used to control whether ray tracing is done with paraxial or real rays.

PAUSE.description: Pauses macro execution, optionally while displaying a status message.

PIXEL.description: Turns on a single pixel on the current graphics screen.

PLOT.description: The PLOT keyword supports a number of arguments used to simplify the task of creating plots of numeric data.

PLOT2D.description: The PLOT2D keyword supports a number of arguments used to simplify the task of creating plots of numeric data.

POLDEFINE.description: Defines the input polarization state for subsequent POLTRACE calls.

POLTRACE.description: Calls the OpticStudio polarization ray tracing routines to trace a particular ray through the current system.

PRINT.description: Output constant text and variable data to either the screen or a file, depending upon the current status of the keyword OUTPUT.

PRINTWINDOW.description: Prints any open graphic or text window.

QUICKFOCUS.description: Focus by adjusting space before image plane

RAYGENERATOR.description: Runs the ray generator, which is used to create a source ray file from a Radiant Source ModelTM file.

RAYTRACE.description: Calls the OpticStudio ray tracing routines to trace a particular ray through the current system.

RAYTRACEX.description: Calls the OpticStudio ray tracing routines to trace a particular ray from any starting surface through the current system.

READ.description: Reads data from an existing text file opened for reading by the OPEN command.

READ_LOCALE.description: Reads data from an existing text file opened for reading by the OPEN command.

READNEXT_LOCALE.description: Reads data from an existing text file opened for reading by the OPEN command.

READNEXT.description: Reads data from an existing text file opened for reading by the OPEN command.

READSKIP.description: Reads any number of unwanted characters from an existing text file opened for reading by the OPEN command.

READSTRING.description: Reads data from an existing text file opened for reading by the OPEN command.

RELOADOBJECTS.description: Reloads NSC objects into the NSC Editor.

REMOVEVARIABLES.description: Sets all currently defined variables to fixed status.

RESUMEUPDATES.description: Prevents any UI editor windows from being updated by ZPL commands while suspended, and RESUMEUPDATES ends the suspension.

REWIND.description: Erases the last line printed by the PRINT command, up to the previous end of line.

SAVEARCHIVE.description: Saves the current lens to a Zemax archive (*.ZAR) file.

SAVEDETECTOR.description: Saves the data currently on an NSC Detector Rectangle, Detector Color, Detector Polar, or Detector Volume object to a file.

SAVEMERIT.description: Saves the current merit function to a file.

SAVETOLERANCE.description: Saves the current tolerances to a file.

SAVEWINDOW.description: Saves the text from any text window to a file.

SCATTER.description: Used to control whether sequential surface scattering is done while tracing rays.

SETAIM.description: Set the state of the ray aiming function

SETAIMDATA.description: Sets various data for the ray aiming function

SETCONFIG.description: Sets the current configuration for multi-configuration (zoom) systems.

SETDETECTOR.description: Sets the coherent or incoherent detector data for any pixel on a detector rectangle object.

SETMCOPERAND.description: Sets any row or configuration of the Multi-Configuration Editor to any numeric value.

SETNSCPARAMETER.description: Sets the parameter values of any object in the NSC editor.

SETNSCPOSITION.description: Sets the x, y, z or tilt x, tilt y, tilt z position of any object in the NSC editor.

SETOPERAND.description: Sets any row or column of the Merit Function Editor to any numeric value.

SETSYSTEMPROPERTY.description: Sets properties of the system, such as system aperture, field, wavelength, and other data.

SETTEXTSIZE.description: Changes the size of the characters drawn by the GTEXT command.

SETTOL.description: Sets the data in the various columns for any tolerance operand in the tolerance data editor.

SETVAR.description: Changes the state of variables for optimization.

SETVECSIZE.description: Changes the maximum size of the VEC1, VEC2, VEC3, and VEC4 arrays.

SHOWBITMAP.description: Displays a BMP, JPG or PNG file in a viewer window.

SHOWFILE.description: Displays a text file to the screen using the OpticStudio file viewer.

SOLVEBEFORESTOP.description: Enables ZPL solves to be placed on surfaces prior to the stop surface.

SOLVERETURN.description: Returns a computed solve value back to the editor calling the solve.

SOLVETYPE.description: Changes the solve status on a given surface and value.

SUSPENDUPDATES.description: Prevents any UI editor windows from being updated by ZPL commands while suspended.

TESTPLATEFIT.description: Calls the test plate fitting routine.

TOLERANCE.description: Runs a tolerance analysis and saves the tolerance report to a text file.

UNLOCKWINDOW.description: Unlocks any one or all locked windows.

UPDATE.description: Updates data required for both sequential and non-sequential ray tracing.

XDIFFIA.description: Computes the Extended Diffraction Image Analysis feature and saves the result to a ZBF file.

ZBF2MAT.description: Converts a ZBF file to a Matlab MAT file.

ZBFCLR.description: Clears the complex amplitude data in a ZBF file.

ZBFMULT.description: Multiplies the complex amplitude data in a ZBF file by a complex factor.

ZBFPROPERTIES.description: Opens the specified ZBF file and places various data about the beam in a vector variable.

ZBFREAD.description: Opens the specified ZBF file and places the electric field and beam property data in two user- defined array variables.

ZBFRESAMPLE.description: Resamples a ZBF file to a new width and point spacing.

ZBFSHOW.description: Displays a ZBF file in a viewer window.

ZBFSUM.description: Sums either coherently or incoherently the data in two ZBF files and places the resulting data in a third ZBF file.

ZBFTILT.description: Multiplies the data in a ZBF file by a complex phase factor to introduce phase tilt to the beam.

ZBFWRITE.description: Writes electric field and beam property data arrays to a ZBF file.

ZRD2MAT.description: Converts a ZRD file to a Matlab MAT file.

ZRDAPPEND.description: Appends data from one ZRD file onto the end of a second file.

ZRDFILTER.description: Opens a ZRD ray database file, applies a filter, and saves the filtered subset of rays to a new ZRD file.

ZRDPLAYBACK.description: This keyword reads a ZRD file, and adds ray amplitude data to one or all detectors.

ZRDSAVERAYS.description: Opens a ZRD ray database file, applies a filter, and saves the rays in the filtered subset that intersect a specified object number.

ZRDSUM.description: Concatenates two ZRD files into a third file.
